oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Interview - Kris Kristofferson - 1995-mm-dd
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Interview with Kris Kristofferson by an unidentified host interviewer. Includes answering questions from the internet while streaming. circa 1995.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Kris Kristofferson;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Comment about interview being captured on audio / (00:54) Kris talks about previous interviews done during the day / (01:09) Kris talks about what he's currently listening to and how he appreciates Bob Dylan's guitar playing / (02:39) His current ties to the Rio Grande Valley / (03:54) Writing with the other Highwaymen and each of them being individual loner types / (05:24) Asked about new film that he's been working on and talks about filming Lone Star / (06:19) Working on his latest album with Don Was and being asked to write extra verses on songs for the album / (08:24) Where the inspiration for the song Worth Fighting For came from / (10:30) Talks about the recording of Me And Bobby McGee by the Grateful Dead and his reaction to Jerry Garcia's death / (12:50) Kris asked about his most prized possessions / (13:36) First recorded song / (15:51) Talks about Janis Joplin / (18:23) Where he's going after this interview and show in Memphis tomorrow /

(18:55) Talks about his friendship with B.B. King / (19:41) Talks about his show business career / (20:12) Comparing songwriting to acting, getting offers to do films and always wanting to be a songwriter / (22:20) The story of landing a helicopter on Johnny Cash's house / (23:52) Former jobs he's had and ending up in Nashville and never having to work a regular job again / (25:59) Talks about The Johnny Cash Show television show and it's importance to his career / (27:23) Where he thinks country music is heading and where it is now / (28:10) Songwriting and what he hoped would happen when he first came to Nashville / (29:34) More comments about Jerry Garcia and the Grateful Dead's influence on music / (32:02) Kris asked his age (59) / (32:37) Why he did new arrangements of older songs on the new album / (34:22) Considering himself a folk singer and not a country singer / (36:01) Where the inspiration for How Under The Gun came from /
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Kristofferson, Kris; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
